div.p: Greetings. The most noble Count Ulysses is hastening his departure; therefore, I am brief as requested. Many of their honors have been deprived and also punished, among others, our two mint masters have been fined about 400 crowns; but the true master, who wanted to give them the sack, who has long been a plague to the republic, has been recognized as worthless and without honor for life and fined 1200 crowns. Soon the court will go to Valtellina for the reformation of the monasteries and the goods of the monks. - It is said to be certain that the Spaniard asked the Venetians for Crema, Bergamo, and Brescia, but in vain; therefore, he has ordered several regiments of landsknechts." "whom I commend to you in every way as a divine man. - On May 6th, our consul will appeal to the court for a mitigation of the judgment. It is ordained that pensions be distributed among the common people; 2. that if one has an office, no one else should seek it; 3. that one who has sworn to foreign lords should neither be used in court nor council. This is enough. May 7, 1573.
